text: from the age of 17 i was homeless and
spent periods of time sleeping rough i
dropped out of school at the age of 13
i'd lost all hope of going to college
like everyone else after four years of
being on and off the street i finally
found a community college willing to
take me in that year we worked on a
project where we helped launch a mini
data center within the school little did
i know that that wasn't going to be the
last time i worked on servers i became
certified through the course which led
to me being scouted by a company that
works with aws i worked every ticket i
could researched every resolve on my
site and created a troubleshooting
mindset from that
eventually i was able to interview for a
full-time position and today i'm an aws
data center technician
my role is to maintain servers and
networking devices which empower how
much capacity we can offer our customers
to be a great data center technician you
need to have strong knowledge in
hardware and networking outside of my
day-to-day role i'm a member of glamazon
a group for lgbtq plus employees the
women at amazon affinity group
women at dub dcs which is a localized
group for women in data center spaces in
dublin i'm also launching pwd dublin the
first people with disabilities affinity
group in ireland i really enjoy learning
new things about infrastructure
operations and what each team does
and it doesn't matter where you come
from at aws there was even one tech we
hired that was a butcher for 20 years
before you joined us and you can create
your own career path with locations
across the globe you can work anywhere
you like
there are limitless opportunities at aws
as we expand and we actively work to
make our spaces diverse and inclusive
